meanings.definition: Having a limited or definite number or amount.
meanings.sent1: The toy store only had a finitely small selection of puzzles.
meanings.sent2: She was able to count the finitely number of apples in the basket.
meanings.sent3: It was a finitely challenging task to find a needle in a haystack.
meanings.sent4: The finitely sized cake was not enough for all the guests.
meanings.sent5: The finitely marked trail led us through the forest.

meanings.definition: In a finite manner or to a finite extent.
meanings.sent1: The water in the glass will finitely evaporate over time.
meanings.sent2: He could only run finitely fast due to his injury.
meanings.sent3: She sang finitely softly to not wake up the baby.
meanings.sent4: Time passed finitely slowly as they waited for the results.
meanings.sent5: The sun set finitely behind the mountains.
